caption: I went to see ‚ÄúCyrano de Bergerac‚Äù and it was amazing. The show was full of laughter and such a great experience. The theater itself is pretty amazing. Even though the plays are in French ,I recommend going there for a great moment.

Tourists usually don‚Äôt come here because the plays are in French. But I assure you this historical theater is absolutely worth getting a ticket to come see a play (especially since they are reasonably priced). Don‚Äôt forget to visit the bar. It‚Äôs the most amazing bar ever.
Such an iconic historical building. Staff is very efficient and friendly. Saw La vie de Galilee which was incredible!
Special glasses make it possible for English speakers to enjoy the wonderful show.

This historic theater is a must for everyone visiting Paris for a longer period of time.  Tips : You can order tickets by phone as well. Booking for 3-4months in advance will give you the chance to get the site you want.  Just outside the main entrance you will also find a small shop of the theater.

Beware of the seat you buy. I bought a 17‚Ç¨ seat for the Miser (l'Avare) and as you can see had close to no visibility of the stage which is completely unacceptable (all the more so as reduced visibility was not mentioned in the booking). Seems the Com√©die Fran√ßaise became just a money machine
What a beautiful theatre! I went to see one of my favorite plays, Cyrano de Bergerac, and the comedians were amazing!

L'Avare at Comedie Francaise. Excellent entertainment. Top class Moliere comedy. Complimentary smart glasses translation from Comedie Francaise worked really well especially for old style french and rapid dialogue sections. A bit uncomfortable but worth it.  Thoroughly enjoyable performance.
Incredibly beautiful theater. I saw a great play (Fanny and Alexander), produced at a very high quality level. Fantastic evening.
This place was such an aesthetic place. Lovely place to pass by.
One of the best comedian group I know - famous plays of french history ; Cyrano de Bergerac, le malade imaginaire, , etc ,, in a beautiful and authentic theater full of statues and gold
A temple of French theater with an amazing cast of comedians able to perform any theatrical genre. This time to see the cherry orchard by Tchekhov. A fantastic evening!
Wonderful public theater to see contemporary and ancient plays ! Renovation scheduled in 2020 !
Old and classy theater in a good sense. Amazing interior and ambiance, truly historical place
Great place, saw " L'Avare" and "La Ceriseraie" there !!!
Fabulous food ... Excellent wine list .... Wine bar next door

I'm not sure what I was expecting when I bought the tickets, but I was blown away by what I received. Whisked Away by absolute Magic on stage. Every time I go to Paris I will make sure to check the schedule and try to align it with the show and available seats. If you are in town, even if you do not speak French, go immerse yourself.
Nice place to visit and take pictures
Great venue , entertaining show
The house that Moli√®re built, nice building, beautiful art, great plays. The only caveat is on the comfort side, but this is as expected in a historic playhouse.
Historic theatre with loads of history.
Historic and beautiful theater, and an amazing adaptation of Jean Renoir's La Regle du Jeu.

This building is beautiful outside and gorgeous inside! Beside being sure to enjoy a show (only in French) played by the best actors, you enter a monument of French history as much as the Le Louvre almost across the street. Good to note that from security officers outside the building to the lady who seats you, everyone is extra friendly. A must visit place.

Very nice old French theatre, with paintings everywhere, old fashion bar during entract, balconies, etc... For students it's great as you can attend a play for 5‚Ç¨, getting there 1h before show starts. But you will be poorly sitted, visibility is reduced and you have to either stand up or get your neck wrecked üòè. Anyways it's worth the price -you are aware... and actors are guaranteed to be good ! If you pay full price its quite comfortable. And the show may also be among spectators.
amazing actors, very well prepared and good french theatre plays.

The national theatre . Great shows , they play the classic repertory . The building it's self is amazing . The bar upstairs is open before and during the mid show pause , with many sculptures and painting of actors that worked here the quality of the shows is top rate as are the costumes and stage settings . I have seen many shows here and was very content . All the shows are in french so some times I go back a second time , or read the play before I see the show .
The nest of French classical theater known as the house of Moli√®re. Best place to see a classical play.

I recommend arriving one our before the beginning to go to "le petit bureau" wich is one the left of the entrance. There you can only pay in cash but they always keep 95 seats at 5‚Ç¨ of you don't mind not having a great seats position.
Historic and cool experience.

You pay 43 EUR to see a show and you come with a hand suitcase trolley and they say they cant save it in the cloakroom for you because they do not have cloakroom. Same day I found the cloakroom is just in the first floor before entering the theatre. Very disappointed with the service.
Marvelous theater. Full of history with Moli√®re‚Äòs chair you can see at the entrance.
Dinner show that featured Fawlty Towers cast.  Everyone enjoyed their show and meal (43 people).  Everyone went away happy and commenting on the high caliber of the actors.

La Com√©die Fran√ßaise is a national theatre built in the 1600s by king's decree. You can regularly watch performances there throughout the season. If you arrive an hour ahead of scheduled performance times you can sometimes snag ‚Ç¨5 "limited view" seating tickets.

One of the most important cultural institution in France, you must get there once in your life even if you don't speak French. In the neighbourhood you have good Japanese restaurants and on place Colette just on the right of the comedie francaise there is a very nice cafe with a very large terrasse which gives a nice view on the opera neighbourhood. Book your tickets in advance and enjoy.
Lovely little gem near the Louvre/Palais Royal area
Never been there for a performance, but I visited the theater, which is beautiful, and it's an institution in France. Cream of the cream if you like theater, which I don't...
The quintessential Parisian theatre. Productions are often excellent with lavish sets. The building itself is a gem. Don't miss Moliere's final armchair!
So beautiful
